Blog

In the RWD blog, we talk about the process of creating a new responsive web design course. The blog will also house recaps of our individual class sessions. You can get more updates by following @RWDKent on Twitter.

Latest Posts

Nov
06

Week 11 Preview - Performance and Advanced Web Tools

In the next class, we’ll talk about advanced web tools, like preprocessors, static site generators and JavaScript/JQuery, and how these can be integrated while keeping performance in mind.
Oct
30

Week 10 Preview - Responsive Images and HTML Wireframing

We’ll continue practicing with CSS Media Queries in class. We’ll also be talking more about how images can be made to be more responsive, and we’ll start wireframing your project assignments in HTML.
Oct
23

RWD to be Offered Spring 2016 + Week 9 Preview

Based on your survey responses so far and interest from other students, we’ve decided to repeat the RWD class for the spring 2016 semester!
Oct
16

Take the RWD Survey + Week Eight Preview

This week, I’d like to get your feedback. Since we’re about half-way through the semester, the mid-semester survey will help me determine how things are going and where I can improve.

08

Week Seven Preview - Style Tiles, Web Type and CSS Continued

We’ll be continuing our section on CSS and visual design patterns in the next class.
Oct
01

Week Six Preview - Design Patterns and CSS

In the next class we go from content to talking about design patterns, styles and an introduction to CSS. This means we’ll finally start to add some colors, typography and visual styles to our HTML.
Sept
24

Week Five Preview - Mobile First

The last class was all about content. In the next class, we’ll get into how to display that content using mobile-first principles.

Sept
17

Week Four Preview - Content-First Design and HTML

In the last class, we really got rolling by completing our first HTML assignment, setting up our GitHub repositories and discussing research in the web design process.

I’ve gotten questions about which text editors are the best for installing on students’ personal Windows/Mac computers.

Week Three - HTML and Research

During the last session, we completed our in-class RWD case studies, set up GitHub and CodePen accounts and talked a bit about how HTML is used to structure a website.

Thank you all for a great first class! I think this is going to be an awesome semester.

Welcome to Responsive Web Design!

I just wanted to send a quick note to introduce myself - my name is Chris, and I’ll be your instructor for the Fall 2015 Responsive Web Design class. The class meets on Tuesday evenings from 5:30 - 8:15 p.m. at IdeaBase in Downtown Kent.
